intro: Rosa stenodonta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved rose, is a species of flowering plant in the Rosaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, particularly in countries like Kazakhstan and Uzbekistan. The plant is characterized by its narrow, serrated leaves and clusters of fragrant, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Rosa stenodonta is a perennial shrub that typically grows to a height of 1–2 meters. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological studies and horticultural research.
